result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, court costs and victim witness surcharges.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds. Balance to be paid by 12/31/16.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or controlled substances.
No possession nor use of any firearms or supplies for firearms.
No cash in any amounts over $200.00.
No possession of any drug supplies.
No living where any weapons are kept.
Do not be in any vehicle  where weapons are.
Comply with any orders regarding child support.
Possess only one cell phone with only one telephone number.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.  
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danny L Peterson in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Danny L Peterson in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for zero days. (Motion for sentence credit must be filed by 04-17-15  any objection to sentence credit to be filed by 05-01-15.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.


-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12-31-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12-31-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-No possession nor use of any firearms or supplies for firearms
-No cash in any amounts over $200.00
-Possess only 1 cell phone with only 1 telephone number
-No possession of any drug supplies
-Comply with any orders regarding child support
-No living where any weapons are kept
-Do not be in any vehicle where weapons are
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Danny L Peterson in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Danny L Peterson in custody. Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. 
As to the Oral Amended COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Scheduling Conference scheduled for 3-17-2015 is vacated. Case is adjourned for Sentencing hearing on 4-2-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

On oral motion of the State, Court ordered amended charge Count 2 amended to Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (Cocaine) (>15-40 Grams), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1m)(cm)3, 939.50(3)(d), a Class D Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danny L Peterson in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Danny L Peterson in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Attorney Klimetz informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Court finds that defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently  waives his right to counsel.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel and scheduling to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Danny L Peterson not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew A Lamke in court, defendant Danny L Peterson not in court, in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #02CF6435 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Michael Wawrzyniakowski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is calendared for a Scheduling Conference on May 20, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 26, Judge Pocan.

Defendant Danny L Peterson in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Danny L Peterson in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT AS TO COUNT 1:POSSESSION WITH INTENT TO DELIVER CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE (COCAINE) (>15-40 GRAMS), SECOND AND SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s)961.41(1m) (cm)3, 939.50(3)(d), 961.48(1)(b), a Class D Felony.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
